Analogy Casey could share with Pat for his COPD diagnosis:
In this case, this analogy could be shared to help Pat understand, visualize and share his diagnosis. This approach fits well in this princiuple of awareness but also works well with communication as casey using this Analogy shows a personal communciaiotn and empathy. 
"Think of your lungs as a car engine - they need oxygen to run properly. With COPD, your engine is struggling to get the oxygen it needs to run efficiently, which can cause it to break down more quickly. By taking care of your lungs and making lifestyle changes, you can give your engine the fuel it needs to keep running smoothly and prevent further damage."
